item.title: Python Apps the Right Way: entry points and scripts
item.dc:creator: Chris “Kwpolska” Warrick
item.description:
The­re are mul­ti­ple ways to wri­te an app in Py­thon. Ho­we­ve­r, not all of the­m pro­vi­de your users with the best expe­rien­ce.

One of the pro­blems so­me pe­ople en­co­un­ter is wri­ting launch scripts. The­ best way to han­dle this is the En­try Po­ints me­cha­nism of Se­tup­to­ol­s, and a __ma­in__.py fi­le. It’s qu­ite easy to im­ple­ment. If you’re in­te­re­ste­d, re­ad on to le­arn mo­re!
